description: Very useful for all users
What's the command to access the emojis? On windows it is "winkey" + "."
summary: There is no hotkey to access..

description: a lot faster than searching google
It's really easy to use and the system wide search function integration is fairly fast (you can search using either the unicode number or the symbol name)

Feels like every GNOME product nowadays is simplified to the point of childishness, and completely gutted of settings/preferences, not to mention all utliity. Characters is a great example of that. BIG fonts and whitespace does not equal good design!
summary: Can't Stand The Direction GNOME Is Moving

description: good app keep it
This application pales in comparison to 'Character map'.
it's useful but the ui makes me want to vomit thanks

Why does Gnome depend on this application?
All these dependencies are why LXDE is a thing.
It's a small and useful app that does what it says. I personally like the categorisation, which makes it easier to look for certain symbols.
summary: Does what it needs to do

description: Simple & efficient app !
This does not seem to allow switching emoji packs, so some will be used as default when installed.
summary: Careful what emoji pack you install

description: is not working in ubuntu 19.04
Works great for finding unusual symbols such as © or various emojis. I particularly like that I can select them using Gnome Shell.
What is the keyboard shortcut to launch the app?
summary: App is ok but imposible to find any document on how to use it

description: This app does exactly what it is supposed it. It boots up quickly and has a respectable selection of icons that are visually appealing!

First and foremost is that I do not see the Arabic Numerals (or numbers) in the characters list which is a big shortcoming. It should be possible to make a list of favorite characters for easy access. Also, I agree with one of the reviewers that a lot of whitespace may not be good because it makes the field much smaller. I really need the number unicodes because my keyboard doesn't print some numbers. Thanks for your attention.

I like the layout of the app. I just wish it had a Darkmode/Night Mode with dark background instead of the white.

Also, for each symbol used currently 4 operations need to be done: Select (click), Copy (enter), Paste (Ctrl+v), Close emoji dialogue box. This is the reason I don't like to use it.

Make it simpler. One click/doubleclick or Ctrl+Click = Copy. No dialogue box. 2-step: Copy and Paste.

One of reasons I am moving to linux is for the freedom of choosing which apps I have on the system. This won't let me remove it so leaves with the same bad taste windows 10 does with their list of unremovable tools. Will have to look at other desktops if there's no workaround.
Excellent application, Just missing the option to select or contain favourite characters in a separate group. Appreciate it ?
It's useful basically
I can't find a way to uninstall this.

I always like to try ones that say "Can't start" or "doesn't work" etc.. so I installed it. (Shouldn't have, nautilus crashed and I should reboot first) but seemed to work ok.. as for Alberto: can't uninstall..? Have you uninstalled any other software with this before? I clicked the "Remove" button, and it seemed to uninstall.
Doesn't start? "Launch" seemed to be the usual way, and seemed to work.
As for Qrest... Hey.. why don't You write a better one?  Complaining about a little utility that does *exactly* what it says.. Even says "simple" .. people just love to complain. Works as advertised on Ubuntu 20.04
Since you can't type emojies on a computer, this is perfect! I use the unusual letters to write my name.
Why is this even in gnome?
Not sure why we would use this instead of other options

This program is awful. Interface needs total design rethink, and I'm not just thinking of the visuals. The GUI does not fluidly support the typical use that I can imagine the majority of users requiring. If you were going to write a program to overcome the very many shortcomings of Character Map then surely you would not design or write this.

Does not even include superscript 2 even though it has a Mathematics section.

Sorry to diss your work; I'm just shocked. Uninstall.
summary: Awful! Idiotic interface and massively lacking in usefulness

description:
Works perfect on Xubuntu 20.04 and for those who are not looking for zillions of Emojis.
It just works, thank you.

I guess if you just want to scroll through a bunch of emoji, you're good to go. But if you want Greek, or Cyrillic? You won't find them under "Letters". You can get to them by searching, but that also brings a lot of other cruft. And a search for "IPA" or "phonetic" turns up no results, so the entire block of phonetic extensions is apparently inaccessible, unless you search on a character-by-character basis and know the Unicode name for what you're looking for. The old version of this utility I remember from many years ago actually worked, letting you select Unicode blocks by name by scrolling down the list. This new one is almost useless for the very thing a character map is supposed to do: display a map of characters.
summary: Practically unusable; worst character map I've seen

description: wanted to thank the icon choosing, it's the best!

It functions. I use it a lot.
But, you cannot search for some invisible characters (e.g. Space, No-break Space), and it likes showing uppercase results rather than what you searched.

It crashes occasionally and is often slow to open (Intel i7) ☹
Works as it should!

Not long ago I literally looked through my pc to see if there was a way I could find a face, emoticon, whatever you want to call it. Just now I discovered I have this app installed, yet I didn't know it. If this has emoticons than it must not be user-friendly, that or it does not work at all - since I did literally look to see if I this ability and found nothing very recently. I now see it only because I looked through "currently installed" items, but even here on this page it does not say how to find it (key to press?) to get use out of it, and to search for the name "characters" is not common sense, especially if you don't know about the app.

I'm dissapointed by the lack if functionality the app has, it's useful for using emojis maybe, but doesn't let you navigate the UNICODE format, you can't, for example, search a specific range in a font (say U+B000).
summary: I was expecting something equivalent to WIndows's Char Map

summary: soy de colombia GRACIAS señor linux

description: Buena aplicación para visualizar los caracteres y los emoticonos
Me ha costado mucho eliminarla.

Tiene lo suyo. Está bien para poner emoticonos en los textos. En todos los textos. Sirve en los chats desde los buscadores de internet y también en ofimática. Mi hijo lo usa mucho para personalizar sus trabajos de la escuela. No le encuentro nada malo. creo que es un buen trabajo.

De forma simple puedes acceder a aquel símbolo o icono que buscas. Se ha de tener en cuenta que según la tipografía que uses tendrás unos u otros caracteres. Yo lo utilizo para mejorar aspectos del blog con una gran rapidez
summary: Facilita mucho la inserción de iconos e imágenes

description: alguien que use ubuntu 20.04 tiene la idea de como configurar un acceso diresto del teclado que funciones bien y se pueda configurar al teclado directo?

Ce sont, non pas des images, mais bien des caractères - du coup je peux agrémenter mes scripts, programmes, ou autre en injectant directement le caractère dans le code, sans avoir à chercher le code UTF/unicode.
summary: Très utile pour rendre plus lisible une sortie de commande

description:
Vraiment simple et très pratique, j'adore l'idée.
Il manque à mon gout une navigation au clavier pour pouvoir copier/coller des caractères spéciaux sans utiliser sa souris.

Il manque plein de caractères, ce qui fait que cette application ne peut pas remplacer gnome-characters. De plus, il n'y a pas d'option pour choisir les emoji en nmoir et blanc ou en couleur. Ceci dit, pour trouver des emoji, c'est plus facile que gnome-characters.
Ça dépanne, mais bon...
Cool Mais svp ne pas ajouté l'émoji avec le Mr Enceinte Merci
summary: Cool Mais svp ne pas ajouté l'émoji avec le Mr Enceinte Merci
